alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, south central Pulaski, northeastern McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kidder, or 13 miles south of Somerset, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sloans Valley around 645 PM EDT. Greenwood, Parkers Lake, Alpine and Wiborg around 650 PM EDT. Beulah Heights around 655 PM EDT. Honeybee around 700 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cumberland Falls S.P., Duckrun, Youngs Creek, Krupp, Deering, Bark Camp, Bounty, Clio and Redbird. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
